title: gc: do not expose center dot name in method error
body:
This program:

package main

func fn(func()) {}

type T struct{}
func (t T) M() {}

func main() {
	t := T{}
	fn(t.M)
}

Triggers this compilation error:

prog.go:10: must call t.TÂ·M

It would be nice if it said something like:

prog.go:10: cannot use method (type (t T) func()) as type func() in function argument
